DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Second-Look Surgery Not Performed Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a free text to explain the reason why a surgery not performed after primary treatment to determine whether tumor cells remain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Second-Look Surgery Not Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a surgery not performed after primary treatment to determine whether tumor cells remain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Surgery performed after primary treatment to determine whether tumor cells remain.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Surgery performed after cancer treatment to assess the results of prior treatment and to plan possible future treatment.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
